subject: Programming
title: Hash Functions
description: A micro-lesson that makes Hash Functions usable.

hook.text: A hash function turns any input into a fixed-size number. Same input always gives the same output.

buildup.text: Good hash functions distribute keys uniformly across the table, minimizing collisions.

discovery.text: Even a tiny change in input should produce a completely different hash â€” the avalanche effect.

twist.text: A bad hash function clusters keys in the same slots. Performance degrades from O(1) to O(n).

climax.text: Hash functions power not just hash tables but also checksums, passwords, and digital signatures.

punchline.text: A good hash scatters data evenly and predictably.

quiz.question: What is the avalanche effect in hashing?
options: Small input changes produce very different outputs
Multiple inputs produce the same output
